title: NIFI-9688 Improve Logback shutdown handling
body:
#### Description of PR

NIFI-9688 Improves Logback shutdown handling, avoiding premature closure of the Logback context during application shutdown, and enabling log messages to be written during application termination.

The default [LogbackServletContainerInitializer](https://github.com/qos-ch/logback/blob/v_1.2.10/logback-classic/src/main/java/ch/qos/logback/classic/servlet/LogbackServletContainerInitializer.java) registers a `LogbackServletContainerListener` that closes the Logback context on web application shutdown. When Jetty registers NiFi web applications, it configures the Logback initializer using the standard Java ServiceLoader. With this behavior, Jetty calls `contextDestroyed` on the Logback Listener before NiFi termination has completed. This results is missing a number of log messages when shutting down NiFi.

Setting the `logbackDisableServletContainerInitializer` environment variable to `true` disables the default Logback listener registration, avoiding the premature context shutdown. Adding the `DelayingShutdownHook` to the `logback.xml` configuration allows Logback to perform a clean shutdown after NiFi termination has finished.

title: NIFI-9724 Add set-sensitive-properties-algorithm command
body:
#### Description of PR

NIFI-9724 Adds a new `set-sensitive-properties-algorithm` command to `nifi.sh` providing the ability to change the value of `nifi.sensitive.props.algorithm` in the `nifi.properties` configuration.

The command follows the same approach as the `set-sensitive-properties-key` command, reading the flow configuration location from `nifi.properties`, and using the current property value to decrypt sensitive properties present in flow configuration files. The implementation refactors the class supporting `set-sensitive-properties-key` to a new shared `FlowEncryptorCommand` class. Updates also include a new section in the Administrator's Guide describing command arguments and supported algorithms.

title: NIFI-9679 Add access-environment-credentials permission
body:
#### Description of PR

NIFI-9679 Adds a new component required permission named `access-environment-credentials` and applies the permission restriction to `AWSCredentialsProviderControllerService` and `GCPCredentialsControllerService`.

Both the AWS and GCP services include support for implicit default credentials.  When deployed with granular component restrictions, this new permission allows administrators to restrict access to service provider credentials that may be present in environment variables or default file locations.

title: NIFI-9716, NIFI-9577: Addressed issue in the PathFilter for GetFile /…
body:
… ListFile. For any file that is found in the Input Directory directly, it was previously being listed/fetched even if it didn't match the PathFilter. Additionally, updated the code to create a new File FIlter for every invocation of onTrigger. This was necessary for NIFI-9577 because the directory to monitor supports Expression Language and as a result may change from invocation to invocation, if using a function such as now() but the PathFilter would always relativize the path based on the value that was obtained when the processor was scheduled.

title: NIFI-9233 - Improve reliability of system integration tests
body:
#### Description of PR

Various code fixes related to Github/CI system test failures.
- Capture troubleshooting data on job timeout.
- Capture `maven-failsafe-plugin` output on job failure.
- System test timing adjustments to reduce diagnostic noise.
- Log PID on startup / shutdown to identify source of orphaned processes.
- Fix for `LoadBalanceSession` handshake failure (which causes test timeouts).
- Fix for `LoadBalanceSession` session wrapup (which can cause test timeouts).
- Logging allowing for identification of load balance failures.
- Retry NiFi process shutdown if needed during system test case teardown.
- Fix logging typo.
- Log IDs of both ends of LoadBalance connections (to help identify failure cases).
- Retry ReportingTask query on incomplete response.
- Do not mask `InterruptedException` while waiting for system test actions to complete.
- Retry service queries until expected state is verified.
- Short waits between actions (when needed) to allow FlowManager state to become consistent.
- Comment out ReportingTask system test failures to allow NIFI-9717 to be addressed asynchronously.
- Adjust system test cluster configuration to avoid test failure condition.
- Adjust `logback` logging for system test profile (include timestamps).

In order to streamline the review of the contribution we ask you

title: NIFI-9711 Add support for flow.json.gz in SetSensitivePropertiesKey
body:
#### Description of PR

NIFI-9711 Adds support for processing the flow configuration stored in `flow.json.gz` when running the `set-sensitive-properties-key` command.

Changes for [NIFI-9069](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/NIFI-9069) in PR #5514 introduced support for persisting the NiFi flow configuration in both XML and JSON.

Updates to the `set-sensitive-properties-key` command support processing both the XML and JSON configuration files when found, providing compatibility with earlier versions.

title: NIFI-9706 Add Memory Consideration to JoltTransformJSON
body:
#### Description of PR

NIFI-9706 Adds a `SystemResourceConsideration` annotation with `SystemResource.MEMORY` to the `JoltTransformJSON` processor. The `JoltTransformJSON` processor reads the entire FlowFile content into memory prior to executing the Jolt transformation, which can result in memory errors when the object representation exceeds available heap memory.

#### Description of PR

NIFI-9692 Upgrades Apache Commons Lang3 to 3.12.0 and moves version management to the root Maven configuration.

Numerous modules referenced various versions of Commons Lang3 using specific version numbers. With the limited numbers of changes present in Commons Lang3 versions, maintaining a shared version at the root project level ensures consistent behavior across all modules.

title: NIFI-9527 Upgrade snappy-java to 1.1.8.4
body:
#### Description of PR

NIFI-9527 Upgrades `snappy-java` to 1.1.8.4 for all components using the root Maven configuration. The majority of existing components depend on version 1.1.1.3 or higher. The HBase 1 and HBase 2 client service modules, as well as the Hive 1 module depend on version 1.0.4.1.

The [snappy-java](https://github.com/xerial/snappy-java/blob/master/Milestone.md) release notes describe changes between versions. Version 1.1.7.6 made Java 8 the minimum supported version. Version 1.1.2-RC1 notes backward compatibility to 1.0.5. More recent versions support additional native architectures.

This upgrade addresses also addresses compatibility issues when attempting to run NiFi on Java 17.

title: NIFI-9673 Improve DBCP and HikariCP test reliability
body:
#### Description of PR

NIFI-9673 Improves DBCP and HikariCP test reliability with separate random database directories and invocation of the Apache Derby shutdown command after test completion. Using a different temporary directory for the Derby log also avoids file locking issues.

Additional changes include updating `DBCPServiceTest` to JUnit 5, and defining the pool name property based on component identifier in `HikariCPConnectionPool` for easier troubleshooting.

title: NIFI-9672 FIx Indeterminate Map Ordering in TestFetchHBaseRow
body:
<!--

  WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied.
  See the License for the specific language governing permissions and
  limitations under the License.
-->

#### Description of PR
The undetermined iteration order of `HashMap` causes flakiness in class `org.apache.nifi.hbase.TestFetchHBaseRow` tests
`testFetchSpecificColumnsToContentWithBase64`, `testFetchToAttributesWithBase64Values`, `testFetchToAttributesWithStringValues`, `testFetchToContentWithQualifierAndValueJSON`, and `testFetchToContentWithStringValues`. The problem can be solved by replacing `HashMap` with `LinkedHashMap`, which has predictable iteration order.

One can reproduce the errors as follows:
1. compile `mvn install -DskipTests -pl nifi-nar-bundles/nifi-hbase-bundle/nifi-hbase-processors -am`
2. run tests with NonDex `mvn -pl nifi-nar-bundles/nifi-hbase-bundle/nifi-hbase-processors edu.illinois:nondex-maven-plugin:1.1.2:nondex -Dtest=org.apache.nifi.hbase.TestFetchHBaseRow`. One can also run the tests separately, by adding the name of the test: `mvn -pl nifi-nar-bundles/nifi-hbase-bundle/nifi-hbase-processors edu.illinois:nondex-maven-plugin:1.1.2:nondex -Dtest=org.apache.nifi.hbase.TestFetchHBaseRow#testFetchToContentWithQualifierAndValueJSON`

title: NIFI-9655 Add Queue Logging to ListenUDP
body:
#### Description of PR

NIFI-9655 Adds queue size debug logging to `ListenUDP` and `ListenUDPRecord` through updates to the `AbstractListenEventProcessor`.

The debug logging occurs at most once per minute. The implementation uses an `AtomicLong` to track the minimum next timestamp in milliseconds for logging, and relies on processor scheduling for logging invocation. This approach avoids running an additional thread for background logging, and expects that the processor will be scheduled more often than 60 second intervals. The implementation leverages a custom `TrackingLinkedBlockingQueue` to maintain the largest queue size over the lifecycle of the processor.  Restarting the processor resets the queue and associated largest queue size tracking.

title: NIFI-6740: Add configuration options to specify NiFi/Bootstrap communication ports
body:
#### Description of PR

The NiFi and NiFi Bootstrap processes both bind to random ephemeral
ports to allow for inter-process communication (e.g. shutdown, port,
ping, etc.). However, the randomness of these ephemeral ports can pose
challenges for some security policies and firewall rules.

This adds two configuration options, nifi.bootstrap.listen.port and
nifi.listener.bootstrap.port, that allow an administrator to define
which ports the two processes should bind to for this communication,
making it easier to define security policies. The options default to
zero to maintain the current ephemeral port behavior.

fixes bug NIFI-6740

title: NIFI-6699 Correct SFTP symbolic link handling
body:
#### Description of PR

NIFI-6699 Corrects handling of symbolic links for `GetSFTP` and `ListSFTP` processors, which both use the `SFTPTransfer.getListing()` method to retrieve a listing of remote file information.

The current behavior evaluates the `FileMode.Type` property of each remote file and handles all symbolic links as directories when the the calling processor has the `Follow symlink` property is enabled.  With this approach, `SFTPTransfer` adds all remote symbolic links to a list of directories selected for recursion, including symbolic links to files. The results in a `FileNotFoundException` when `SFTPTransfer` attempts to read a symbolic link file as a directory.

To resolve this problem, the remote resource filter now performs a remote `stat()` request when evaluating a symbolic link for potential inclusion as a directory to read. The `stat()` request traverses the symbolic link on the remote system and returns the associated file attributes, including directory status. This approach allows the `SFTPTransfer` remote resource filter to determine whether or not to process the symbolic link as a directory.  The additional `stat()` request is necessary because symbolic link attributes do not indicate whether the link points to a regular file or directory.

The additional `stat()` request has a potential performance impact when listing directories with large numbers of symbolic links. The `Follow symlink` property is disabled by default, so this change does not impact default processor behavior.

Additional changes include refactoring the `SFTPServer` test class now named `TestServerSFTPTransfer` to run as a unit test.  Updates to the test include migrating to JUnit 5, allowing the test to run on all operating systems, and leveraging the standard JUnit 5 `TempDir` annotation for the test SFTP server.

title: NIFI-9638 Refactor Google Guava usage in extensions
body:
#### Description of PR

NIFI-9638 is the second set of changes refactoring Google Guava references across multiple extension modules.

The majority of the changes involve updates to test classes. Several updates include updating Google Guava to 31.0.1. Additional updates include removing direct references to Google Guava classes, although the library remains a required dependency in some modules.

Changes impact the following modules:

- nifi-accumulo-processors
  - Refactored collections references
- nifi-aws-processors
  - Updated unit test class
- nifi-azure-bundle
  - Removed direct references and upgraded transitive dependency to 31.0.1
- nifi-cassandra-bundle
  - Set provided scope in Processor and Services NAR modules to avoid unnecessary copies
  - Set cassandra.guava.version to 19.0, which is the latest version supported in the Cassandra driver
- nifi-datadog-reporting-task
  - Refactored references and removed direct dependency
- nifi-enrich-processors
  - Refactored references and removed direct dependency
- nifi-evtx-processors
  - Upgraded dependency from 28.0 to 31.0.1

  - Removed direct references and upgraded transitive dependency to 31.0.1

  - Removed unused test dependency

NIFI-9638 Refactors and removes direct references to the Google Guava library in multiple `nifi-framework` and `nifi-standard` modules. body:

Observed a NullPointerException in embedded ZooKeeper shutdown while running system tests.  This was causing FlowController shutdown to fail, which resulted in lingering threads and cluster node shutdown hang.  Catch and log the exception, which will allow the process to shutdown cleanly.

title: NIFI-9624 Remove JCenter Repository
body:
#### Description of PR

NIFI-9624 Removes JCenter Repository references from NiFi and NiFi Registry Maven configurations.  JFrog [announced](https://jfrog.com/blog/into-the-sunset-bintray-jcenter-gocenter-and-chartcenter/) decommissioning of the JCenter repository in February 2021, but decided to maintain the repository in read-only mode as of April 2021.

Removing JCenter references required the following adjustments:

- Removed `moquette-broker` test dependencey from `nifi-mqtt-processors`, refactored impacted unit tests, and removed integration tests
- Upgraded `docker-compose-rule-junit4` test dependency from 1.5.0 to 1.7.0
- Changed `jstl` dependency Group Identifier from `javax.servlet.jsp.jstl` to `javax.servlet`

title: NIFI-9630 Migrate Registry REST API docs to swagger-codegen
body:
#### Description of PR

NIFI-9630 Migrates the NiFi Registry REST API documentation generation from `swagger2markup-maven-plugin` to `swagger-codegen-maven-plugin`.

The [Swagger2Markup](https://github.com/Swagger2Markup/swagger2markup) project is no longer maintained and the last release of the Maven plugin was in 2018.  These changes also remove the need for the `asciidoctor-maven-plugin`, which converts the documentation to HTML.  Although the styling is somewhat different, the generated HTML documentation contains the same information and the `swagger-codegen-maven-plugin` is actively maintained.

Additional changes include removing the templates associated with the generation of other unused REST API documentation for NiFi Registry.

This migration also supports removing dependence on the read-only JCenter repository since Maven Central does not contain all of the transitive dependencies that Swagger2Markup requires.

NIFI-4239 - Adding (REFACTORED) CaptureChangePostgreSQL processor to capture data changes (INSERT/UPDATE/DELETE) from PostgreSQL tables via Logical Replication API.

Authors:
Davy Machado machado.davy@gmail.com
Gerdan Santos gerdan@gmail.com

Thank you for submitting a contribution to Apache NiFi.

Please provide a short description of the PR here:

#### Description of PR

The CaptureChangePostgreSQL processor retrieves Change Data Capture (CDC) events from a PostgreSQL database. Works for PostgreSQL version 10+. Events include INSERT, UPDATE, and DELETE operations and are output as individual flow files ordered by the time at which the operation occurred. This processor uses a Logical Replication Connection to stream data and a SQL Connection to query system views.

This new pull request builds upon the original PR #4065, but all the code was refactored. Some improvements are:

- Java best practices followed;
- Optimized connection management;
- Added cdc.lsn and cdc.type attributes;
- Simplified change reading and decoding process;
- Problematic Initial Snapshot functionality removed;
- Better exception handling;
- Javadoc descriptions improved;
- Unit and Integration Tests created.

title: NIFI-9233 - Improve reliability of system integration tests
body:
#### Description of PR

Alter CI logic of `system-tests` such that they are only run on a schedule on the base repository.  This is to avoid resource contention caused by repo forks also scheduling system tests to run at the same time.

When we re-enable system tests to run on pushes, we might re-evaluate this approach.  It should be possible to run system tests on forks, just not on a (shared) schedule.  The situation we want to avoid is having all enabled forks (potentially hundreds) simultaneously requesting macos and linux build nodes for an operation that is expected to take ~1 hour.  Hopefully this will help the system-test suite to run with greater stability.

In order to avoid the potential for resource contention at 0000Z with existing forks (who have not pulled this change), adjust the daily schedule trigger time.


In order to streamline the review of the contribution we ask you
